name: opendia
description: No need to switch browsers, just use Dia on Chrome or on Arc.
readme_summary: OpenDia is a browser extension that allows AI models to control and automate tasks within Chromium-based browsers. It leverages existing browser data and supports various AI models, enabling users to automate workflows such as social media posting, content summarization, web application testing, and research, all while maintaining privacy by running locally.
key_features: Connects AI models to browsers for automation.
Leverages existing browser data (accounts, passwords, cookies).
Supports various AI models (Claude, ChatGPT, Cursor).
primary_use_case: Automating browser tasks using AI models, including content creation, social media management, productivity, research, development, and testing.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled conductor orchestrating a symphony, but instead of musicians, they are directing web browsers. Each browser, represented by its logo (Chrome, Arc, Edge, etc.), plays a specific task - filling forms, posting on social media, or testing a web app - all in perfect harmony. The conductor's baton is a glowing AI interface, seamlessly connected to each browser, interpreting commands and ensuring smooth execution. Subtle code snippets and data visualizations float around the scene, adding a touch of technical detail. The scene is set in a modern, minimalist studio with soft, diffused lighting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and crisp details.

name: DotDotGoose
description: DotDotGoose is a free, open source tool to assist with manually counting objects in images
readme_summary: DotDotGoose is an open-source tool designed to aid in the manual counting of objects within images. It facilitates the collection of point data, which can be valuable for training and validating computer-assisted counting models. The tool is primarily intended for use in fields like wildlife research, where accurate object counts are crucial.
key_features: Point data collection for training and validation
primary_use_case: Assisting with manually counting objects in images, particularly for wildlife research.
cover_image_prompt: A wildlife researcher meticulously counting geese in a vast, digitally enhanced photograph displayed on a large monitor. The researcher uses a stylus to mark each goose, with small, glowing digital markers appearing on the screen. A flock of geese flies across the monitor's background, subtly transitioning from real birds to stylized, counted icons. The scene is set in a bright, modern research lab with scattered notes and reference materials. A small UI element on the monitor displays the DotDotGoose logo and a live count. The image should be in a clean, flat design style with clear iconography and a muted color scheme.

name: transformerlab-app
description: Open Source Application for Advanced LLM + Diffusion Engineering: interact, train, fine-tune, and evaluate large language models on your own computer.
readme_summary: Transformer Lab is an open-source application designed for advanced LLM and diffusion engineering. It enables users to interact with, train, fine-tune, and evaluate large language models on their own computers. The application supports various features, including one-click model downloads, cross-platform compatibility, multiple inference engines, and tools for RAG, dataset building, and model conversion.
key_features: RLHF and Preference Optimization (DPO, ORPO, SIMPO)
Chat with models (Chat, Completions, Preset Prompts)
Multiple Inference Engines (MLX, Huggingface Transformers, vLLM, Llama CPP)
primary_use_case: Experimenting with, training, fine-tuning, and evaluating Large Language Models on a local machine.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled alchemist in a futuristic workshop, meticulously combining various glowing orbs (representing different LLMs like Llama, Mistral, etc.) into a powerful, unified elixir. The alchemist carefully adjusts dials and levers on a complex control panel, subtly displaying UI elements and code snippets. This elixir flows into a device that transforms it into personalized AI assistants, each tailored to specific tasks. The workshop is bathed in soft, ethereal light, with subtle digital particles swirling around the orbs. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and intricate details.

name: LibreLingo
readme_summary: LibreLingo is a community-owned language learning platform that offers interactive exercises and spaced repetition to help users learn new languages. It features progress tracking and cross-device synchronization, making it accessible on various devices. The platform emphasizes free and open-source courses, promoting community contribution and ownership.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old turtle, wearing a backpack filled with books and maps, stands at a crossroads, pointing travelers towards different language pathways. Each path is marked with signs representing various languages and cultures. UI elements float around the turtle, displaying language learning exercises and progress trackers. The scene is set in a vibrant, stylized world with clear, intuitive iconography. Small code snippets related to language processing subtly appear as part of the landscape. The image should be in a flat design style with bright colors and clean lines.

name: Nimbus
description: An open source alternative to Google Drive, One Drive, iCloud, etc.
readme_summary: Nimbus is an open-source cloud storage solution designed as an alternative to mainstream services. It utilizes PostgreSQL for data storage and Valkey for caching. The platform supports user authentication via Google and Microsoft, providing a comprehensive and self-hostable cloud storage experience.
primary_use_case: Open source alternative to cloud storage solutions like Google Drive, OneDrive, and iCloud.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled architect meticulously organizing and filing blueprints within a vast, luminous cloud-shaped archive. The architect, representing the user, carefully places documents (data) into clearly labeled folders, symbolizing organized cloud storage. Subtle digital interfaces float nearby, displaying file structures and access permissions. The scene is bathed in soft, ethereal light, emphasizing the secure and accessible nature of the cloud. The repository name, 'Nimbus,' is subtly etched onto the archive's entrance. Rendered in a clean, 3D isometric illustration style with a calming blue and white color scheme.

name: filebrowser
readme_summary: FileBrowser Quantum is a web-based file manager that provides an easy way to access and manage files from the web. It offers features such as multiple source support, various login options, a revamped UI, simplified configuration, efficient indexing, improved browsing, and a developer API, making it a comprehensive solution for self-hosted file browsing.
key_features: Login support for OIDC, password + 2FA, and proxy
Better listing browsing with more file type previews
Developer API support with Swagger page
cover_image_prompt: A librarian meticulously organizing files within a vast, digital library. The librarian uses a glowing interface to sort documents, images, and videos, placing them into clearly labeled virtual folders. A holographic display shows a simplified file directory structure, reflecting the library's organization. Subtle UI elements and file icons float around the scene, connecting the metaphor to software. The library is bathed in soft, ambient light with a clean, organized aesthetic. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.
